result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael C Shortt was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Per order of the Court on 1-27-15, Court orders zero days sentence credit.
Time shall be served consecutive to any other sentence Defendant is serving.
Defendant shall become eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program only after serving a minimum of 36 months confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

10/29/14 Sentencing Hearing

Def appears in custody via video conference & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to appear in person for hearing; Court finds Defendant consents to the use of video conferencing.  Court addresses sentence credit issue; statements by counsel.  Court orders that Judgment of Conviction be modified to zero days credit.

Sentencing hearing on October 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Resolution reached; State to cap confinement recommendation.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Guilty plea entered.  Defendant admits to priors.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and by operation of law Ct. 2 merges into Ct. 1.   Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Court revokes bond.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial. Amended criminal complaint filed adding Ct. 2;  Information filed and reading waived.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Copy; 8/26/14; Dodge Correctional Institution

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State. Counsel's first appearance.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Absolute sobriety
Hearing on July 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty. Nadya Perez-Reyes from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter J Cannon for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant may be on a probation hold.  State requests cash bond.  $10,000 cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
